original_title: ADB’s technical assistance for future water supply operations
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Asian Development Bank had noted that it was willing to provide the necessary knowledge and technical support for Sri Lanka’s new reform operation program in the water supply sector, along with capacity building projects of the National Water Supply and Drainage Board.

This was revealed during a meeting between the President’s Senior Adviser on National Security and Chief of Presidential Staff Sagala Ratnayaka, and Takafumi Kadono, Resident Mission Director of the Asian Development Bank, said the President's Media Division.
The meeting extensively examined the plans and monitoring framework for the water supply sector in Sri Lanka, as well as discussed future steps.
